newsitem.title: USA: US Airways CEO 1996 salary at $452,000.
newsitem.headline: US Airways CEO 1996 salary at $452,000.

text.p: Stephen Wolf, chairman and chief executive officer of US Airways, was paid a salary of $451,923 in 1996, according to a proxy filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
In 1996, US Airways granted Wolf, 55, a stock option covering 1.3 million shares, effective January 16, and 325,000 shares of restricted stock, effective January 22, 1996.
The strike price for the stock option was $12.1875 per share for all options that expire February 16, 2006, US Airways said.
Wolf was appointed chairman and CEO in January 1996, succeeding Seth Schofield, who retired after 38 years with US Airways, US Airways said in the proxy.

Upon his retirement, Schofield received an aggregate of $1,719,231 and based on an employment agreement, was entitled to receive payment for his six-month consulting arrangement at a salary rate of $500,000.
